New Records: Canada recorded their first-ever ICC T20 World Cup win.
Key Match Events: Canada beat Ireland by 12 runs in a thrilling match in New York.
Jeremy Gordon took 2 wickets for 16 runs from 4 overs.
Dilon Heylinger took 2 wickets for 18 runs from 4 overs.
Barry McCarthy took 2 wickets for 2 runs in the penultimate over.
Pre-Game Insights: Ireland won the toss and opted to bowl first.
Craig Young was brought into the side as an additional seam option.
Post-Match Reflections: Canada's win was described as their biggest result in history.
Ireland's defeat leaves them needing something special to reach the Super 8 phase.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York.
Canada's total of 137/7 was the highest score on this ground in three tournament matches.
Canada had only one previous win over a full member nation (against Ireland in 2019).
